results.snippet: 'Weight' in Space   Q. I heard that the American astronaut Dr. Norman Thagard lost weight while he was on the Russian space station. How do you weigh a person (or anything else) in space?    A. "Since we can't actually weigh astronauts in...
results.lead_paragraph: 'Weight' in Space Q. I heard that the American astronaut Dr. Norman Thagard lost weight while he was on the Russian space station. How do you weigh a person (or anything else) in space? A. "Since we can't actually weigh astronauts in weightlessness, we use body mass measurements to determine any change in weight," that is, what the astronaut would weigh under the influence of earth gravity, said Eileen Hawley, a spokeswoman for the National Aeronautics and Space Administration Johnson Space Center in Houston.

headline.main: Rockwell and Lockheed to Form Venture to Get NASA Contract

results.snippet: The Rockwell International Corporation and the Lockheed Martin Corporation agreed yesterday to form a joint venture in an effort to meet NASA's goal of using a single prime contractor for the space shuttle program.   The equal partnership would be...
results.lead_paragraph: The Rockwell International Corporation and the Lockheed Martin Corporation agreed yesterday to form a joint venture in an effort to meet NASA's goal of using a single prime contractor for the space shuttle program. The equal partnership would be called the United Space Alliance, and both partners would contribute personnel, the companies said.

headline.main: 3 Million in U.S. Are at Risk of Measles for Skipping Vaccine, Health Officials Say

results.snippet: An estimated three million Americans ages 20 to 37 are at risk of catching measles, which is more dangerous to adults than to children, because they never received a second dose of vaccine, Federal health officials said last week.   Hoping to...
results.lead_paragraph: An estimated three million Americans ages 20 to 37 are at risk of catching measles, which is more dangerous to adults than to children, because they never received a second dose of vaccine, Federal health officials said last week. Hoping to prevent outbreaks of measles on college campuses, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention is urging every student who is missing the immunization to get it.

results.snippet: Bicycle Paths  Liberty State Park Wolf Drive, Jersey City Recommended ages: 4 and up    Urban bicyclists are always looking for untrammeled places to pedal. And though the bicycle path, which is a mile and a half long, at Liberty State Park is not...
results.lead_paragraph: Bicycle Paths Liberty State Park Wolf Drive, Jersey City Recommended ages: 4 and up Urban bicyclists are always looking for untrammeled places to pedal. And though the bicycle path, which is a mile and a half long, at Liberty State Park is not new, the quiet park makes you feel as if you have crossed more than a state line.

headline.main: The Quiet Life as Pursued by David Hartman

results.snippet: AS THE HOST OF ABC'S "GOOD Morning America" for more than 11 years, David Hartman interviewed Presidents, kings and movie stars, guided his program as it developed from brash upstart into top-rated morning show, had a daily audience of more than...
results.lead_paragraph: AS THE HOST OF ABC'S "GOOD Morning America" for more than 11 years, David Hartman interviewed Presidents, kings and movie stars, guided his program as it developed from brash upstart into top-rated morning show, had a daily audience of more than seven million viewers and pocketed a $2 million annual salary. Then he simply walked away. Such voluntary departures from television's equivalent of the catbird seat are rare, particularly at the height of one's career. And for Mr. Hartman, who arrived at ABC in 1975 as a journeyman actor and left in 1987 as a household name, the move was conspicuously bold.
